messages: 16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:14): wrapped code is cross-platform, yes
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:14): it's hashed by a proprietary algorithm
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:14): you mean database procedures, etc?
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:15): wrapped pl/sql code
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:15): packages, procedures, functions, etc.
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:15): yes, that should be cross-platform.  i can't think of anything off the top of my head that would be platform-dependant
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:15): normallon one wraps the package body
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:16): leaving the package speck readable
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:16): i'm not a big fan of that
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:16): i'd rather have the source so i can custom modify and report bugs, etc.
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:17): I"d rather have it wrapped on the custoemr end
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:17): leave a copy so YOU Can see it
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:17): but distribute the wrapped code elsewhere
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:17): i hope i never have to buy your product
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:17): it prevents unauthorised modifictions
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:17): our entire ERP system has open code
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:18): and for me, that makes life great
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:18): i don't have to sit and wait 2 weeks while a vendor tries to explain what the code is supposed to do
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:18): that's bad, in my opinion, as I've worked with systems like that and the end-user has added code to packages and procedures
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:18): i can go look
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:18): we add stuff all the time
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:18): then it becomes a support issue
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:19): and you have an agreement with the vendor that you can change whetever you like in the code whenever you like
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:19): i don't know.  i don't read the contracts.
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:19): either way, we do it.  the vendor doesn't support it, so...
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:19): you chould, if you're jacking with the source code
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:20): so you lose your support license and if you fuck up the app you're on your own
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:20): good thinking
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:20): i just find that obfuscated code doesn't gain as much as people think, and it hinders people like me
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:21): it's SUPPOSED to hinder people like you who screw sith code you don't understand
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:21): like i said... i hope i never have to work with any of your products
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:21): no, you don't understand
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:21): certainly I do
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:21): you jack with the source
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:21): when my organization needs something to get done today, we can't wait for the vendor to react
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:21): you lose support licening
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:21): you could open yourself to a lawsuit
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:22): all because you think you're smarter than the vendor
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:22): we've been working with the vendor on a *very* minor modification to another system
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:22): it's been 2 months
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:22): i could have completed it in about a week
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:22): so?  they have more than just YOU to consider
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:22): and yes, sometimes i am smarter than the vendor... remember, i get to see their code
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:23): not if you lose your support agreement, violate your licensing and end up in court
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:23): either way, the point is moot
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:23): you'll never convince me that your opinion is even close to correct
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:23): for you, maybe that's just peachy
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:23): nor i the same to you
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:24): i think vendors need to quit being so scared
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (18:24): i can see the xfs code in kernel, but i think, i will never edit it :-)
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (18:24): but if i know, how it work, i can use it knowledge.
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:24): hell: if it works, why even bother :)
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:25): "never argue with an idiot.  they will bring you down to their level and beat you with experience."   therefore, this discussion is over
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (18:25): black box things a very cool, while they work :-)
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:25): jackfig: thank you for the personal attack.  that shows a lot about you.
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:26): the packages supplied by Oracle are wrapped
16ef9805bf33329f1375a7f3b63f4569 (18:26): THEY won't let you get in and 'dick' with their code
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:26): and i don't need to modify Oracle either
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:26): i need to modify our administrative systems
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (18:26): oh, i go home, boys :-)
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (18:26): and life is good
